definitions.title: n.f. maid, handmaid
definitions.body: (Ph. [[אמת]], Ar. 0’am-ah;un, Sab. [[אמת]] in n.pr. Sab. Denkm.:20, Aram. 0amto0, As. amtu Zim:BP 67)—´[[א]] abs. Ge 21:10 +; sf. [[אֲמָתִי]] Ge 30:3 +, etc.; pl. abs. [[אֲמָהׂת]] Ge 31:33, 2Sa 6:22; cstr. [[אַמְהוֹת]] 2Sa 6:20; [[אַמְהׂתַי]] Job 19:5 etc.—maid, handmaid.

lit. maidservant (= [[שִׁפְחָה]] q,v., wh. however sometimes more servile; rarely P in Hex) Ge 30:3, Ge 31:33 (‖[[שִׁפְחָה]] Ge 29:24, Ge 29:29 P 30:4 f. J etc.) Ex 2:5 (all E); 2Sa 6:20, 2Sa 6:22, Job 19:15, Na 2:8 (sf. refers to mistress, exc. Job 19:15 cf. 2Sa 6:20, 2Sa 6:22); in legisl. (‖[[עֶבֶד]]) Ex 20:10, Ex 20:17, Ex 21:20, Ex 21:26, Ex 21:27, Ex 21:32 (all E) Le 25:6, Le 25:44, Le 25:44 (H) De 5:14, De 5:14, De 5:18, De 12:12, De 12:18, De 15:17 (cf. v. De 15:12) De 16:11, De 16:14; cf. also Job 31:13, Ezr 2:65, Ne 7:67; applied to concubine (sf. of master) Ge 20:17, Ge 21:12, Ex 23:12 (all E) Ju Jdg 9:18, Jdg 19:19; also Ge 21:10, Ge 21:10, Ge 21:13 (Ge 16:1 f. P [[שִׁפְחָה]] q.v.) Ex 21:7 (all E), vid. on this Sta:Gesch i: p. 380.
